column4: hi there, I just bought a new Sony Bravia Led TV, I need a PIC card that output HDMI, any advice on GNU compatible ones ?
I would suggest sticking with nvidia.
nvidia is a driver, but what PCI card can I use ?
what us VDPAU, and I don't think I have PCIe, let me check
Video accelleration. It shares the task between the GPU and CPU for cleaner playback, especially high definition.
ok I have PCIe, so what card would be good ?
pretty much anything nvidia at this point.
ok they do, sorry did not know that, any particular recommendation ?
there are basically 4 manufacturers, nVidia, ATI, intel (these are onboard) and via (also onboard).
anything 8300+ will do VDPAU and play video cleanly. (this includes all of the 2xx-6xx, they are actually newer)
I'd like something silent, I don't mind spending more
the card I showed you is a little old and is not very silent, you would not have something to advise me ?

this is really offtopic for ubuntu support... but I would probably go with something more like this http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E1http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E168141214226814121422
sorry for the off topic, is there a channel for this ? Your link is broken
